page.title: 02The A74,Railway and Clyde.
page.content: Crawford village is by-passed by the A74 dual-carriageway,whichs carries traffic northwards to Glasgow and south to London. The main Glasgow/London railway line passes Crawford carrying passenger and goods traffic north and south.There used to be a station in Crawford but this closed in the 1960's. The famous Scottish River _The Clyde_ flows through Crawford.The source of the Clyde is near Crawford,the river then flows through Strathclyde until it reaches the Atlantic Ocean west,north west of Glasgow.
